summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeLanolips Minty 101 Ointment Balm is a peppermint-charged super-balm. 100% natural with 101 uses.
details: DetailsBenefitsLanolips Minty 101 Ointment Balm a little tube of magicIt can be used on extremely dry lips, skin patches, cuticles, elbows and moreIt's a 100% natural lanolin balm with peppermint oil and vitamin EA super dense balm that seals in moistureFeaturesFemale-Owned Beauty BrandTSA-Approved, travel friendly beauty productCruelty-FreeCertified by Leaping BunnyVegetarian99% NaturalFormulated WithoutArtificial ColorsFragrancesParabensPthalatesPetrolatumPEGsMineral OilItem 2561289How To UseWarm the ointment between the fingers or apply directly onto the lips and skin. Use generously.Precautions: For external use only.IngredientsLanolin*, Aroma (Flavor)*, Tocopherol (Vitamin E)*, Mentha Piperita (Peppermint) Oil*.*Naturally Derived
how_to_use: Warm the ointment between the fingers or apply directly onto the lips and skin. Use generously.Precautions: For external use only.

reviews.headline: Loveee
reviews.comments: Love it such an amazing product

reviews.headline: amazing
reviews.comments: the best lip balm ever! my tried and true. i will always recommend this product.

reviews.headline: Good, but not my favorite
reviews.comments: I'm a fan of the 101 ointments, and Minty is a nice refreshing scent.  It feels just a little tingly on, in a good way.  I enjoy using this one in the morning to prime my lips and at night before bed.  However, in comparison to other 101s, I do prefer other flavors more, such as the Dulce de Leche Gelato.  But if mint is your vibe, you'll like this one.  The formula is thick but not too thick, and it is definitely moisturizing.

reviews.headline: Loved Lanolips since forever
reviews.comments: This is a go to if I'm feeling chapped, not just lips, anywhere for that matter. The mint is not too strong but is refreshing.

reviews.headline: 101s are my favorite!
reviews.comments: I've tried nearly all of the flavors at this point. Mint and peach are my two favorites. This is so hydrating on my lips. I also use it on my nose in the winter and on my cuticles. It's a holy grail product for me.

reviews.headline: perfect product ￼
reviews.comments: I love this brand and all of the products are so amazing. I love this one in particular. I love the scent and the minty feel to this minty balm

reviews.headline: Lanolips = Love
reviews.comments: This product is thick and smooth. The scent isn't as minty as I'd like but it is still very nice. The product is again on the thicker side so the applicator reflects that.

reviews.headline: Best lip treatment ever
reviews.comments: I used to think my holy grail for lips was the vasoline lip teatment but this by far beats it. It actually moisturizes your lips. I live in AZ & its DRY, but one application of this works like a charm.

reviews.headline: Good product but smell not there
reviews.comments: Don't get me wrong. It's a nice good product but the smell it smells like floss and toothpaste.

reviews.headline: Don't buy if you want to waste your money!
reviews.comments: Stop wasting your money on chapsticks and lip moisturers that dont work!!!! I am someone who travels alot.  The air in airplane cabins is often very dry. I LOVE this stuff!

reviews.headline: Feels really nice and smells great
reviews.comments: The minty smell is yummy like a candycane and the texture is really nice! I love that it uses natural ingredients as well!

reviews.headline: So minty ￼
reviews.comments: I love the mint sent in this, and the mint sent feels very tingly on your lips. This is my favorite one by far leaves my lips, soft, moisturizing, minty sensation and plumping.

reviews.headline: Good for the price
reviews.comments: Its a good lip balm a bit sticky and thick for my taste but its good! Does what it claims.

reviews.headline: My winter must have!
reviews.comments: So far this is my fav lip moisturizer product, especially in the winter when my lips tend to dry/chap/crack badly. A little goes a long way. I don't have to reapply often.

reviews.headline: Too sticky for me
reviews.comments: It's extremely thick and sticky. So unless your hair is pulled back and you live somewhere that snows, I wouldn't use it.

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: This wasn't a bad product it definitely hydrated my lips. The only problem I had was the consistency of it. The product was too sticky for my liking.

reviews.headline: Winter Staple!!!
reviews.comments: An absolute must for anyone livinv in a dry climate or loe humidity!! It is my fav lip treatment to apply before bed - will repurchase over and over again!!!!

reviews.headline: QUENCHY VIBES
reviews.comments: Bought on a whim. I am always SO disappointed in lip ointments. I tried this stuff on my eternally crusty lips after suffering from a cold and my lips were instantly QUENCHED with relief. Crusty-winter-lips be-gone! A tiny bit goes a long way, but it works so well, healing and moisturizing your lips quickly. Mint is the way to go flavor-wise. As an added bonus—makes your lips look JUICY.

reviews.headline: Love this stuff so much
reviews.comments: I'm on to my third or fourth tube of this. Its something I need to have everywhere, nightstand, purse, work, car. It smells so nice and is just the best texture. I use it on both my lips and cuticles.

reviews.headline: UNDERRATED
reviews.comments: this product is literally amazing for my acutane lips!!! i have every chapstick on the market and there's nothing like this. great for severe chapped lips!!!

values.label: Consistency of the product is to thick for me
Can be greasy if you have too much on

display_values: Can be greasy if you have too much on
Consistency of the product is to thick for me

faceoff_positive.comments:
I've been in love with the Glossier balmdotcoms for ages now, but I hate that their tubes aren't made for applying into lips! I've been searching for a decent dupe to them for a while now, and this is a perfect dupe for the Glossier mint balm flavor. The consistency is pretty liquid once it melts with your lip temperature, but is semi-thick in texture which is perfect for my lips. My lips get easily chapped very often and they require consistent lip balm application, so I tend to go for more thick textures… plus thicker textures make my lips feel like they've been swaddled in pillows. This balm is pillowy with that lovely mint tingling sensation that mint balms give. This balm also doesn't taste like anything which is something I personally enjoy as I don't want my balm to contribute to my candy cravings. This balm does have a bit of fragrance from the mint, so be warned if you're sensitive to fragrance.

TLDR::
I would recommend this if you: 
- want a thin consistency that warms up to your body temperature.
- want something pillowy on your lips.
- like thicker textures in balms.
- don't want to taste your balms.
- enjoy a minty tingling sensation.
- love Glossier's lip balms.

I would not recommend this if you: 
- don't like thicker textures in your balms.
- want something that doesn't give a tingling sensation on your lips.
- want a balm that has an actual flavor to it.
- are sensitive to fragrance.
faceoff_positive.headline: Glossier Dupe!

faceoff_negative.comments: I like to use this before bed. A minty and cooling sensation. Can feel like there's a lot of "vaseline"  on my lips if I apply more than a pea sized amount
faceoff_negative.headline: Minty fresh
